body_content.explanation: relating to the act of removing parts of a piece of writing that are considered likely to cause offence, or to a piece of writing that has had parts removed in this way:
examples: They created an expurgatory list to be used by the church.
Translations of the text were frequently expurgatory.

body_content.explanation: having the power to remove or clean something that is considered harmful:
examples: They strongly believed in the expurgatory power of fire.
Some of the patients believe that pain is expurgatory, and that painkillers will interfere with this.
